    nixtlar

    The nixtlar package provides R users with a SDK for Nixtla‚Äôs TimeGPT API.

    üîÑ nixtlar: Your Gateway to TimeGPT from R

    With nixtlar you can easily interact with TimeGPT through simple API calls, making the power of TimeGPT readily accessible in your projects. Learn more about TimeGPT here.

    üíª Installation

    You can install the development version of nixtlar from GitHub with:

    # install.packages("devtools")
#devtools::install_github("MMenchero/nixtlar")

    üéàQuick Start

    To use TimeGPT, you first need to request a token from Nixtla. You can do this at https://dashboard.nixtla.io/.

    Once you have the token, you‚Äôll need to set it up in your R session. The nixtlar package provides a function to do this.

    #library(nixtlar)

# Set up token 
#set_token("YOUR_TOKEN")

    You‚Äôll need to set the token every time you re-start your R session. nixtlar also includes a function to validate the token.

    # Validate token
#validate_token("YOUR_TOKEN")

    You don‚Äôt need to validate the token every time you set it up, only when you want to ensure its validity.

    nixtlar provides an easy-to-use function to call the TimeGPT API. It works with both tsibbles and base R data frames.

    # Call the TimeGPT API 
#df <- tssible::as_tsibble(AirPassengers) # df can also be a data frame  

#timegpt_forecast(df, h=8, freq=12, time_col="index", target_col="value")

    üêç Python SDK

    Are you a Python user? If yes, then check out NixtlaTS, a Python SDK for TimeGPT and check out the documentation.
